subject: Real Estate
subcategory: Famous Properties That Changed the World
title: Studio 54: The Nightclub That Changed Real Estate
description: A quick win: understand Studio 54: The Nightclub That Changed Real Estate.

hook.text: In 1977, a former TV studio in Manhattan became the most famous nightclub in the world.

buildup.text: Studio 54 attracted celebrities, artists, and politicians. The door policy was legendarily exclusive.

discovery.text: The club proved that a venue's social cachet could multiply a property's value beyond its physical worth.

twist.text: The owners were convicted of tax evasion in 1979. They'd skimmed $2.5 million in cash from the door.

climax.text: The building survived as a theater. Its legend turned the entire neighborhood into prime real estate.

punchline.text: A nightclub turned a neighborhood into gold.

quiz.question: What did Studio 54 prove about property value?
options: Social cachet can multiply a property's worth
